resources.string: Hello, how can I help you?
Although in most cases, the scrolling function of TextView can be achieved solely through XML settings.

In order to trigger scrolling, the content of a TextView must exceed its visible area. This can be achieved by setting a sufficiently long text content or dynamically adding content. If the height of the TextView is set to match_parent and its parent container\'s height is also large enough, then even if the content is very long, the TextView will not display a scroll bar because its content does not exceed the visible area. Therefore, it is necessary to ensure that the height of the TextView is appropriately limited (such as using wrap_content) or the height of the parent container is set to a smaller value.
